content.rendered:
PRESIDENT & OWNER

Nathaniel Beaver grew up in Nashville, Tenn. A strong work ethic was at the foundation of his youth, watching his mother work as a nurse administrator in women's health and his father as a special education metro school teacher. Beaver began his own career path at the age of 12 and was managing the famed Fox's Donut Den by the age of 16. A diploma from Montgomery Bell Academy in 1999 set the tone for his educational future, and he went on to receive his bachelor's degree in Legal Studies from the University of Tennessee in 2003. Beaver continued his education and received two Masters degrees in Education and Paralegal Studies, all the while working as general manager of multiple restaurants.

In 2006, Beaver purchased Whitfield's Restaurant and Bar and in 2009 he opened Bria Bistro Italiano. In 2011, Nathaniel opened The Harding House at Belle Meade Plantation. With this new restaurant venture, a growing demand for catering presented itself, and Infinity Events & Catering was formed; shortly followed by the creation of the parent company Infinity Hospitality Group.

In August of 2012, the company's flagship project opened at the historic Bridge Building in downtown Nashville. The Bridge Building Event Spaces has become one of the most popular event venues in town and has been voted by the Nashville Scene as having the "Best New View of Nashville." In 2014, The Bell Tower opened as one of the largest, historic event spaces in Nashville. A state of the art renovation of this 145-year-old church has created an event space like no other. Later came the restoration of the iconic 12th & Porter in 2015, a legendary restaurant and concert venue.  

In 2017, Nathaniel began overseeing the new management of The Quarter. This new venue has created a great backdrop for the event services provided by Infinity Events & Catering.

Nathaniel takes great pride in the truly one-of-a-kind company he has created as well as the opportunities it has given all of his staff members. Comprising of over 170 employees, an events and catering company, a production company and five event venues, his vision does not stop there, as multiple new hospitality projects are currently in development.

In addition to Infinity Hospitality Group, Nathaniel started Infinity Properties Partnership, a buyer and lessor of commercial properties throughout the greater Nashville Area. Other ventures include Music City Vacation Homes, one of the top short term rental management companies in the city, and Nashville Event Bartending, a mobile bartending company providing custom bartending options for any event at any location.  

Outside of the office, Nathaniel is dedicated to giving back to the community. In addition to serving as chair for March of Dimes Signature Chef Auction and the P.Hale Montgomery Bell Academy Alumni Golf Tournament, he has been the title sponsor for the Harding Academy Art Show as well as made many contributions to non-profit events throughout the city.
